programme.title: Rise of the Great White Shark
programme.desc: It has been here for millions of years. Lurking in the far corners of our ocean, remaining untouched and unchanged by time. The Great White Shark. How did it come to be one of the world's most ingenious predators? With spectacular footage and animations, Rise of the Great White Shark takes an in depth look into the specific events and adaptations that helped sharks dominate the sea.

programme.title: Sharks: The Big Five
programme.desc: Dive deep into the African waters and discover a new side of these prehistoric predators of the sea.

programme.title: African Nostalgia
programme.desc: This film shuns the spectacle of animals suffering and dying in favor of striking colors and the light, smells, and landscapes unique to this continent.

programme.title: Mummies: Secrets of the Pharaohs
programme.desc: Journey to the royal tombs of Egypt and explore the history of ancient Egyptian society as told through the mummies of the past. Explorers and scientists are piecing together new archeological and genetic clues of Egyptian mummies, and providing a window into the fascinating and mysterious world of the pharaohs, perhaps giving us a glimpse of the future of our own civilization.

programme.title: The Source
programme.desc: Bettany reaches the Egyptian Nile’s southernmost parts. Once a dangerous crocodile haven, now this stretch of the Nile is just startlingly beautiful. Bettany joins archaeologists at the temple of the crocodile god, as they uncover and extract a giant stone message board from the temple foundations that reveals images and hieroglyphics made over a thousand years ago.

programme.title: A Capital Hill
programme.desc: Time Team investigate Caerau Hillfort, a huge hill near Cardiff that may be immensely significant is it the long-lost Iron Age capital of South Wales? Geophysics shows multiple circular marks, indicating several roundhouses. However Francis is having trouble locating these structures in the ground.

programme.title: Brancaster
programme.desc: The National Trust Roman fort of Branodunum has produced some impressive aerial photographs of cropmarks, promising substantial buildings and multiple finds from the second to the fourth centuries AD.

programme.title: Torre Mayor, Mexico City
programme.desc: The strongest building on Earth, Torre Mayor, is constructed to withstand earthquakes that would obliterate the average skyscraper. Built in the wake of Mexico City’s most devastating earthquake, this building has become a haven in one of the world’s most active seismic zones, but can the ever growing height of skyscrapers compete with typhoons and earthquakes?

programme.title: Eureka Tower, Melbourne
programme.desc: Vertical City goes down under to the tallest residential building in the world: the 300 meter Eureka Tower, the most exclusive address in the Southern Hemisphere. Is living the high life destroying our traditional city communities? Are these Vertical Villages changing the way future generations will live?

programme.title: Commerzbank, Frankfurt
programme.desc: The skyscraper is a symbol of aspiration and power, and an environmentally unsound energy guzzling monster, but in 1997, Norman Foster created a contradiction: the world’s first ecological tower. The Commerzbank in Frankfurt has changed the construction of office buildings forever, but was going green the result of the corporate world being responsible, or just a big fat PR exercise?

programme.title: The "Off-Season" S1:E8 "Plantation Story"
programme.desc: Every year we try to incorporate new projects to drastically change the quality of habitat we have on the farm for our wildlife. A couple of years ago that project was to create a small hunting plot in the middle of a heavily wooded area in one of our prime hunting locations. This project has turned into what we now call “The Plantation Plot”. As a deer manager creating habitat for the wildlife is one of the most rewarding things you can do. In previous episodes, we went over things like what to do prior to planting, annual vs perennial plots, and even breaking down brand new property. But in this episode we will come full circle, and apply all of those concepts, to create a successful food plot from scratch.

programme.title: The "Off-Season" S1:E9 "Frost Seeding"
programme.desc: Frost Seeding. It's a practice commonly overlooked, but when done correctly can produce major results at a time when wildlife need it the most! And with very little equipment required, this method of establishing food plots is perfect for just about anyone!

programme.title: The "Off-Season" S1:E10 "Trapping"
programme.desc: In the previous episodes of The “Off-Season”, we have talked about creating food sources and building habitat for the wildlife on your property. While these areas of land management are crucial, a successful land manager must also keep their eye on the predator population. Animals such as coyotes, raccoons, and fisher, as well as fox and possums, all prey on either young turkeys or young deer, making it important to control their numbers in order to have the best hunting opportunities.

programme.title: The "Off-Season" S1:E1 "Who We Are"
programme.desc: Welcome to the very first episode of The Bearded Buck's brand-new land management series called, The "Off-Season". This series will consist of short episodes dealing with the specifics of our land management tactics including everything from food plots, timber stand improvement, property development, trapping, and much more. We hope to show more of what it takes to set up a successful farm and what we do when we are not sitting in a tree stand hunting.

programme.title: The "Off-Season" S1:E2 "Soil Samples"
programme.desc: In order to be a successful land manager that maintains a healthy wildlife population, your food plots need to be at the top of their game. The best way to achieve a productive food plot is to know exactly what type of soil your land has and what it needs to produce high quality forage. This is where soil samples come into play, arguably the most important step in the entire food plot process!

programme.title: On The Water S17: E7 "Bonito Highs and Lows"
programme.desc: During the summer bonito blitz, the OTW crew puts their efforts towards catching these hard-fighting fish.

programme.title: On The Water S17:E8 "Cape Cod Giant Bluefin Tuna"
programme.desc: Fishing for giant bluefin tuna with Captain John Clothier of Fish Chatham Charters.

programme.title: Two Conchs Sportfishing TV S2:E8 "Two Conchs Fish Camp"
programme.desc: Each year Jack and the Two Conchs crew like to put on a fishing camp. This is an educational few days of fishing that is both good for clients and the crew.

programme.title: Guiding Flow S2:E1 "Once in a Lifetime"
programme.desc: A once in a lifetime opportunity to fully fund Everglades restoration, bring together the entire outdoor community. Listen to some of the biggest voices, watch some amazing Everglades fishing and get involved.

programme.title: Guiding Flow S2:E2 “One Community, One Lagoon”
programme.desc: Capt. Benny Blanco and Hilary Hutchinson target Redfish with local Mosquito Lagoon guide, Capt. Justin Price. Together, they call on the entire outdoor community to come together to help save it.

programme.title: Guiding Flow S2:E3 "Troubled Coastlines: Everglades"
programme.desc: Capt. Benny Blanco hosts a special guest and a legendary family in his home waters of Everglades and Biscayne National Parks. They catch world class fish and discuss the effects of a changing climate.

programme.title: Sweetwater S7:E7 "Power Polling South Bay"
programme.desc: Miles and Joey take Power Pole's Curt Hill fishing in the south Bay of Lake Okeechobee.

programme.title: Growing Deer S13:E45 "Great Hunting Coming Soon To This 40 Acres"
programme.desc: See the plans for this 40 acres to improve the deer hunting and habitat.

programme.title: Growing Deer S13:E46 "Forage Quality and Its Relationship to Antler Size"
programme.desc: Interesting research is being done: influencers of deer antler size and deer body weights.

programme.desc: Go hog hunting in Texas with Dan Pickar. He uses the Sig Sauer ECHO 3 thermal scope.

programme.title: Beyond The Grid S5:E2 "Giant Bull Up Close! Bow Hunting Elk on Public Land in 4K"
programme.desc: Bow hunting the elk rut is wild! It gets western when Dan Pickar calls a mature bull in to 15 yards

programme.title: Beyond The Grid S5:E3 "Public Land Bow Hunting - Spot and Stalk Mule Deer"
programme.desc: Spot and stalk bow hunt public land mule deer with Justin and Dan Pickar.

programme.title: Backcountry Traditions S2:E1 "Alaska Part 1"
programme.desc: Angry Eagle Lodge and Outfitters is a paradise lodge nestled in the corner of lake Lliamna in Alaska. Accessible only by plane, this remote yet luxurious lodge has prime access to the greatest fly fishing waters the world has to offer. This is their story.

programme.title: Backcountry Traditions S2:E2 "Alaska Part2"
programme.desc: Alaska is the crown jewel of fisheries. Its undisturbed ecosystem enables the Bristol Bay region to produce and sustain the world's largest sockeye population. The future of this delicate ecosystem is currently threatened by an existential and non-reversible threat. Knowledge is power. Learn how you can join the fight to save and preserve Bristol Bay.

programme.title: Reel Life Adventures S1:E3 "Florida Pompano and Jet-Skis at Isla Bella"
programme.desc: Tucker and JC Carlson travel deep into the Gulf of Mexico to fish for Florida Pompano and Cobia. They also visit Isla Bella Beach Resort to play a competitive game of cornhole and ride jet-skis.

programme.title: Reel Life Adventures S1:E7 "Two Conchs Kids Fishing Camp"
programme.desc: Tucker and JC Carlson participate in the Two Conchs Kids Fish Camp to teach the next generation about fishing. They catch snapper, goliath grouper and african pompano.

programme.title: Make this Tonight

programme.title: Make this Tonight

programme.title: Daren Streblow - Organic and Inorganic Life
programme.desc: Daren Streblow’s unique style of observational stand-up comedy has been entertaining hundreds-of-thousands of people throughout the United States and around the world since he first stepped on the stage in 1995. Daren headlines churches, fundraisers, corporate functions, and colleges all over North America. He’s a “humor opportunist” who is always looking for the comical side of life and how people live it. He takes topics that everyone can relate to and filters them through his unique lens where connecting A to B leads to a letter in the Greek alphabet or maybe salad dressing.

programme.title: Billy Anderson - America's Sweetheart
programme.desc: Born in Texas and raised in Augusta, Georgia ñ Billy Anderson is stand-up comedian currently living in Seattle, Washington. Heís been seen regionally at SketchFest Seattle, The Washington Comedy Festival, Bumbershoot and was a finalist in the 2016 Seattle International Comedy Competition. Outside of the Northwest, Billy has written for Cracked.Com, performed in SF Sketchfest, LaLaFest Los Angeles, the San Francisco International Comedy Competition and as of 2013 he has performed stand-up comedy in every US state. Billy was recently featured on Audibleís ìSounds Like Americaî hosted by Jackie Kashian and the syndicated program ìLaughsî on Fox television.

programme.desc: Thirty year comedy veteran Dan St. Paul jokes about acting his age, his Italian heritage, and slowly becoming a cylinder the older he gets.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Tommy Drake - Mouse
programme.desc: Tommy’s unique mixture of original material delivered in a classic style has given him the opportunity to do more shows and be seen by more people live than just about any other comic on the planet.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Nazareth - American by Choice
programme.desc: Award Winning Comedian Nazareth, has been seen by over 40 Million people around the world through live concerts, TV and Radio broadcasts. His list of TV appearances include: Comedy Central, ABC Family, NBC, CBS, and TBN.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy: Jim Colliton - Please Take the Lunch
programme.desc: Fueling his comedy with stories from his suburban life, Jim Colliton jokes about shredding children's art work, cats with depression, and wanting to fly separate from his wife.

programme.title: Jay Stevens - Life is Hilarious
programme.desc: Jay Stevens has been a professional comedian for almost 20 years. Growing up, he was known as a hilarious outgoing character by friends, family, colleagues and those he would meet on a first encounter.

programme.title: Rodney Laney - Who is Rodney Laney?
programme.desc: Rodney Laney has completed pilots for Comedy Central, MTV, and A&E. He has been seen on HBO, FOX News Channel’s Red Eye, The Late Late Show on CBS, Comedy Central’s Premium Blend, comedy.tv on the HD channel, two appearances on Gotham Comedy Live AXSTV, and Live in Gotham VR. programme.title: Currents
programme.desc: Dogs can smell explosives and detect medical conditions including seizures, forms of cancer. Inventor Andreas Mershin wants to replicate that in cell phones. WIRED's Emily Dreyfuss spoke with Mershin to find out why that's easier said than done.

programme.desc: This piece of metal is unsinkable. WIRED's Matt Simon spoke with the inventor, Chunlei Guo, about how the superhydrophobic material was created and how it could help prevent disasters at sea.

programme.title: Pyrotechnics Pro Explains the Art of Those Massive Fireworks Shows
programme.desc: Ever wonder how those massive fireworks spectacles get off the ground? From black powder to barium, music to mortars, pyrotechnics pro Jim Souza, whose company puts on the Macy's 4th of July Show in New York, explains the year-long process behind putting on a major performance.

programme.title: We Used to Eat Animals the Right Way - Here's What Changed
programme.desc: Dr. Bill Schindler explains why the processes we have in place today in the food industry lead to a less healthy and enriched lifestyle. The way humans eat animals has shifted. Our brains grew significantly once the human race started hunting its food. Diets that consisted of blood, guts, and organs contributed to that growth. These parts of animals are almost completely absent from modern day diets and these provided much more nutrition than just the animal's meat.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Astronomer George Herbert (C. Thomas Howell) is assigned to investigate reports of strange meteors crashing into earth near New York, Los Angeles and Washington, D.C. As the meteors land, enormous multi-limbed metal creatures disembark and begin destroying everything and everyone in their path with heat-ray guns. Amidst the apocalyptic destruction, Herbert teams with a soldier (Andy Lauer) and a pastor (Rhett Giles) on his journey into Washington to reunite with his family.

programme.title: 40 Days and Nights
programme.desc: When a colossal tectonic shift causes the sea level to start rising, a microbiologist gathers the DNA of as many species as she can, while the military creates an "ark" in a desperate attempt to preserve life on Earth.

programme.title: Android Cop
programme.desc: In this futuristic, action-packed thriller, a cop and his robotic partner enter the Zone, a forbidden section of the city inhabited by a disease-stricken populace. Together, they discover the real reason everyone is sick, and attempt to stop the illness - with the help of the machine's powerful technology and weaponry.

programme.title: CarGo
programme.desc: A young car learns the importance of family when he embarks on a mission to rescue his father - who's been sent to Clunker Island to be repurposed as junk metal.

programme.title: Dragonquest
programme.desc: After the ruthless Krill (Brian Thompson) harnesses the power of a deadly fire-breathing dragon, he begins a bloody campaign of world domination. From the ashes of a scorched village, Arkadi (Daniel Bonjour), an unassuming farm boy, embarks on an arduous journey to restore the lost pieces of a mystical amulet -- the only weapon powerful enough to destroy Krill. With the help of swordsman Maxim (Marc Singer) and his squire, Katya (Jennifer Dorogi), Arkadi struggles to save the world.

programme.title: Hercules Reborn
programme.desc: When a young man's bride is kidnapped by an evil king, he turns to Hercules for help. The fallen hero has been living in exile, banished for killing his family, but the young man's courage inspires Hercules. Together, they fight to rescue the bride and reclaim Hercules' honor.

programme.title: DUST Collection | Double Trouble
programme.desc: Films where characters work together to become unexpected allies.

programme.title: DUST Collection | Spacetime
programme.desc: Characters recognizing their mistakes and attempting to rectify them while stuck in the same day.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E1 | Earth Station
programme.desc: Ex-NASA astronaut Max Levodolinsky readies his piece-of-junk space freighter for his latest transpo run to the Moon—while bickering with Space Traffic Control, his husband, his boss, and… his new pilot-in-training?!?

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E2 | Trainee
programme.desc: Despite his objections, Max is forced to take on fresh astronautics graduate Tommie al-Qasimi. She accidentally unleashes a computer virus that could kill them both after discovering that she can’t stand Max’s taste in music.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E3 | Ransomware
programme.desc: Max and Tommie race against the clock as the virus takes over their ship and thrusts them into the crosshairs of Earth’s orbital defense systems. To Tommie’s dismay, Max makes the most of some very teachable moments.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E4 | Autoreply
programme.desc: Tommie’s boyfriend busts her for using autoreplies to his love letters. But a heart-to-heart about the future reveals a new and even deeper issue between Tommie and Max.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E5 | Replacement
programme.desc: After finding out that Tommie is Max’s replacement, the conversation gets super awkward. But they have to change the subject when their ship gets hit by space junk traveling 10,000 mph.

programme.title: Orbital Redux, S1 E6 | Space Junk
programme.desc: Everything in their ship got hit…including Max. Now he and Tommie have to cobble together a plan to save their lives as the ship tumbles out of control. But that doesn’t stop them from continuing to argue about music.
